column1: Gondomar (Portuguese pronunciation: [ɡõduˈmaɾ] (listen)) is a municipality located in the east of Portugal's Porto Metropolitan Area and 7 km from central Porto. The population in 2011 was 168
column3: in an area of 131.86 km². Gondomar's mayor is Marco Martins.

column1: Gondomar is well known for its jewelry industry
column2: and its name can be traced
column3: like many other toponyms of Northern Portugal
column4: to a prominent Visigothic figure of his day

column2: the municipality is divided into 7 civil parishes (freguesias):

column1: Fânzeres e São Pedro da Cova
The town has one association football team called Gondomar who currently play in the Campeonato de Portugal
column2: the third tier of Portuguese football.
